titles.en: Chapter 9 – The congratulations with the birth
Chapter 9 – The congratulations with the birth

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ مُرَازِمٍ عَنْ أَخِيهِ قَالَ قَالَ رَجُلٌ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) وُلِدَ لِي غُلَامٌ فَقَالَ رَزَقَكَ اللَّهُ شُكْرَ الْوَاهِبِ وَ بَارَكَ لَكَ فِي الْمَوْهُوبِ وَ بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ وَ رَزَقَكَ اللَّهُ بِرَّهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from his father, from Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Al Husayn, from Morazim, from his brother who said, 
‘A man said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘A boy has been born for me’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘May Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Grant you with thanking the Endower, and Bless for you in the endowment, and Make him reach the adulthood, and may Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Grant you (to observe) his righteousness’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ بُنْدَارَ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ الْأَحْمَرِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ أَبِي مَرْيَمَ الْأَنْصَارِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي بَرْزَةَ الْأَسْلَمِيِّ قَالَ وُلِدَ لِلْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ ( عليه السلام ) مَوْلُودٌ فَأَتَتْهُ قُرَيْشٌ فَقَالُوا يَهْنِئُكَ الْفَارِسُ فَقَالَ وَ مَا هَذَا مِنَ الْكَلَامِ قُولُوا شَكَرْتَ الْوَاهِبَ وَ بُورِكَ لَكَ فِي الْمَوْهُوبِ وَ بَلَغَ اللَّهُ بِهِ أَشُدَّهُ وَ رَزَقَكَ بِرَّهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Muhammad Bin Bundar, from Ibrahim Bin Is’haq Al Ahmar, from Abdullah Bin Hammad, from Abu Maryam Al Ansary, from Abu Barzat Al Aslamy who said, 
‘A child was born for Ali<sup>asws</sup> Bin Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup>, so the Qureysh came over to him<sup>asws</sup> and said, ‘Congratulations to you<sup>asws</sup> for the (birth of a) horse-rider’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘And what is this from the speech? You should be saying, ‘Thank the Endower, Blessings be to you<sup>asws</sup> regarding the endowed, and may Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Make him reach the adulthood, and Grant you<sup>asws</sup> (to observe) his righteousness’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ بَكْرِ بْنِ صَالِحٍ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ هَنَّأَ رَجُلٌ رَجُلًا أَصَابَ ابْناً فَقَالَ يَهْنِئُكَ الْفَارِسُ فَقَالَ لَهُ الْحَسَنُ ( عليه السلام ) مَا عِلْمُكَ يَكُونُ فَارِساً أَوْ رَاجِلًا قَالَ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ فَمَا أَقُولُ قَالَ تَقُولُ شَكَرْتَ الْوَاهِبَ وَ بُورِكَ لَكَ فِي الْمَوْهُوبِ وَ بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ وَ رَزَقَكَ بِرَّهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Bakr Bin Salih, from the one who mentioned it, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘A man congratulated a man who had a son, so he said, ‘Congratulations to you of the (birth of a) horse-rider. So Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> said to him: ‘What makes you know that he would be a horse-rider, or a walker?’ He said, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! So what should I be saying?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘You should be saying, ‘Thanks be to the Endower, and Blessings be to you regarding the endowment, and may he reach adulthood, and you be graced with (to see) his righteousness’.
